elements.title: Granzyme K activates the entire complement cascade (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Granzyme K activates the entire complement cascade

  • Carlos A. Donado
  • Erin Theisen
  • Michael B. Brenner
Article06 Feb 2025

elements.title: Superfluid stiffness of twisted trilayer graphene superconductors (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Superfluid stiffness of twisted trilayer graphene superconductors

Measurements of the superfluid stiffness in twisted trilayer graphene reveal unconventional nodal-gap superconductivity, where the superconducting transition is controlled by phase fluctuations rather than Cooper-pair breaking.

  • Abhishek Banerjee
  • Zeyu Hao
  • Philip Kim
Article05 Feb 2025

elements.title: The genetic origin of the Indo-Europeans (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The genetic origin of the Indo-Europeans

Ancient DNA reveals how the explosive expansion of Yamnaya steppe pastoralists began with a small community north of the Black Sea speaking ancestral Indo-European, and detects genetic links with Anatolian speakers, stemming from a common Indo-Anatolian homeland in the North Caucasus–lower Volga region.

  • Iosif Lazaridis
  • Nick Patterson
  • David Reich
Article05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Directly imaging the cooling flow in the Phoenix cluster (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Directly imaging the cooling flow in the Phoenix cluster

Observations of the Phoenix cluster using the James Webb Space Telescope reveal rapid cooling in galaxy cluster cores, driven by black hole jets, with gas temperatures mapped between 105 K and 106 K and cooling rates of 5,000–23,000 M⊙ yr−1.

  • Michael Reefe
  • Michael McDonald
  • Taweewat Somboonpanyakul
Article05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Distributed quantum computing across an optical network link (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Distributed quantum computing across an optical network link

The distribution of quantum computations is demonstrated between two photonically interconnected trapped-ion modules, using repeatable, deterministic teleported controlled-Z gates to perform Grover’s search algorithm.

  • D. Main
  • P. Drmota
  • D. M. Lucas
ArticleOpen Access05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Cretaceous Antarctic bird skull elucidates early avian ecological diversity (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Cretaceous Antarctic bird skull elucidates early avian ecological diversity

A new, nearly complete fossil skull of Vegavis from the James Ross Basin, Antarctic Peninsula, provides insight into its feeding ecology and exhibits morphologies that support placement among waterfowl within crown-group birds.

  • Christopher R. Torres
  • Julia A. Clarke
  • Patrick M. O’Connor
Article05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Metal-halide porous framework superlattices (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Metal-halide porous framework superlattices

Using zirconium metal–organic frameworks as the host template for directed nucleation and precise growth of metal-halide sublattices, multi-dimensional single-crystalline porous superlattices can be achieved through a one-pot synthesis.

  • Wenqiang Zhang
  • Hong Jiang
  • Xiangfeng Duan
Article05 Feb 2025

elements.title: IL-27 elicits a cytotoxic CD8+ T cell program to enforce tumour control (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
IL-27 elicits a cytotoxic CD8+ T cell program to enforce tumour control

IL-27 promotes tumour control by preventing dysfunction and enhancing cytotoxicity of tumour-specific CD8+ T cells.

  • Béatrice Bréart
  • Katherine Williams
  • Nathaniel R. West
Article05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Superfluid stiffness of magic-angle twisted bilayer graphene (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Superfluid stiffness of magic-angle twisted bilayer graphene

Research on superconductivity in magic-angle twisted bilayer graphene reveals unconventional behaviour, an anisotropic gap and a significant role of quantum geometry, using combined d.c. transport and microwave measurements, suggesting new insights into superconductivity mechanisms.

  • Miuko Tanaka
  • Joel Î-j. Wang
  • William D. Oliver
Article05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Engineering a genomically recoded organism with one stop codon (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Engineering a genomically recoded organism with one stop codon

Ochre, a strain of Escherichia coli engineered to have a single stop codon, enables reassignment of four codons for non-degenerate functions, such as incorporation of non-standard amino acids into proteins.

  • Michael W. Grome
  • Michael T. A. Nguyen
  • Farren J. Isaacs
ArticleOpen Access05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Limited impact of Salmonella stress and persisters on antibiotic clearance (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Limited impact of Salmonella stress and persisters on antibiotic clearance

Experiments in infected mice and tissue-mimicking chemostats show that resilience of Salmonella against antimicrobial compounds is largely a result of starvation-induced general resilience rather than survival of a small subset of hyper-resilient cells.

  • Joseph Fanous
  • Beatrice Claudi
  • Dirk Bumann
ArticleOpen Access05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Synthetic lethality of mRNA quality control complexes in cancer (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Synthetic lethality of mRNA quality control complexes in cancer

PELO–HBS1L and SKI complexes in the human mRNA quality control pathway exhibit a synthetic lethal interaction and may represent novel targets for the development of cancer therapies.

  • Vivian Prindle
  • Adam E. Richardson
  • Joshua P. Plotnik
ArticleOpen Access05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Quantum coarsening and collective dynamics on a programmable simulator (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Quantum coarsening and collective dynamics on a programmable simulator

A programmable quantum simulator based on Rydberg atom arrays is used to study the collective dynamics of a quantum phase transition and observe the phenomenon of quantum coarsening.

  • Tom Manovitz
  • Sophie H. Li
  • Mikhail D. Lukin
ArticleOpen Access05 Feb 2025

elements.title: A genomic history of the North Pontic Region from the Neolithic to the Bronze Age (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A genomic history of the North Pontic Region from the Neolithic to the Bronze Age

Whole-genome sequencing analysis of 81 prehistoric individuals reveals how the genetic makeup of people from the North Pontic region was influenced by waves of migration during the Eneolithic period and Early Bronze Age.

  • Alexey G. Nikitin
  • Iosif Lazaridis
  • David Reich
Article05 Feb 2025

elements.title: SKI complex loss renders 9p21.3-deleted or MSI-H cancers dependent on PELO (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
SKI complex loss renders 9p21.3-deleted or MSI-H cancers dependent on PELO

Analysis of large-scale CRISPR screening data, combined with experiments in patient-derived tumour organoid models, identifies PELO as a potential therapeutic target in chromosomal 9p21.3-deleted cancers and microsatellite-unstable cancers harbouring specific mutations.

  • Patricia C. Borck
  • Isabella Boyle
  • Francisca Vazquez
ArticleOpen Access05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Transforming US agriculture for carbon removal with enhanced weathering (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Transforming US agriculture for carbon removal with enhanced weathering

A state-level analysis of the impact of enhanced weathering deployment on carbon sequestration on agricultural land suggests that enhanced weathering could help the USA meet net-zero 2050 goals.

  • David J. Beerling
  • Euripides P. Kantzas
  • Maria Val Martin
ArticleOpen Access05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Topological water-wave structures manipulating particles (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Topological water-wave structures manipulating particles

Interfering water waves can be tailored to realize topological structures, namely wave vortices, skyrmions and polarization Möbius strips, that can be used to manipulate particles floating on the water surface.

  • Bo Wang
  • Zhiyuan Che
  • Jian Zi
Article05 Feb 2025

elements.title: A comprehensive spatio-cellular map of the human hypothalamus (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A comprehensive spatio-cellular map of the human hypothalamus

HYPOMAP integrates single-nucleus RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomic data to create a comprehensive spatio-cellular map of the human hypothalamus.

  • John A. Tadross
  • Lukas Steuernagel
  • Giles S. H. Yeo
ArticleOpen Access05 Feb 2025

elements.title: RUNX2 promotes fibrosis via an alveolar-to-pathological fibroblast transition (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
RUNX2 promotes fibrosis via an alveolar-to-pathological fibroblast transition

The use of two mouse models of pulmonary fibrosis helped the identification of the transcription factor RUNX2 as a regulator of the transition of alveolar fibroblasts to pathological fibroblasts.

  • Yinshan Fang
  • Sanny S. W. Chung
  • Jianwen Que
Article05 Feb 2025

elements.title: Differential protection against SARS-CoV-2 reinfection pre- and post-Omicron (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Differential protection against SARS-CoV-2 reinfection pre- and post-Omicron

Two distinct patterns in the protective effect of natural infection against reinfection in the Omicron variant versus pre-Omicron eras show that SARS-CoV-2 immune protection is shaped by dynamic interaction between host immunity and viral evolution.

  • Hiam Chemaitelly
  • Houssein H. Ayoub
  • Laith J. Abu-Raddad
ArticleOpen Access05 Feb 2025
